{{ddcl | header=experimental/ranges/tuple | since=ranges | 1=
template&lt; TaggedType... Types &gt;
using tagged_tuple = /* see below */;
}}

Convenience alias template for naming a {{tt|ranges::tagged}} wrapping a {{lc|std::tuple}}.

A {{rconcept|TaggedType}} is a function type {{tt|S(T)}}, where {{tt|S}} is a {{rconcept|TagSpecifier}} and {{tt|T}} is the type of the element.

{{c|tagged_tuple&lt;S1(T1), ..., SN(TN)&gt;}} is an alias for {{c|ranges::tagged&lt;std::tuple&lt;T1, ..., TN&gt;, S1, ..., SN&gt;}}.

=== Notes ===
Because a function type is used to "glue" the tag specifier and the corresponding element type together, the usual parameter type adjustments apply. In particular, top-level cv-qualifiers are removed and array types are adjusted to pointers: {{c|tagged_tuple&lt;tag::in(const int* const), tag::out(int[])&gt;}} is {{c|ranges::tagged&lt;std::tuple&lt;const int*, int*&gt;, tag::in, tag::out&gt;}}.
